title: Week in Pictures: Migrants rescued, Tomatina Festival, US Open
text:
ABC News photo editors chose the best news images of the week for this collection. </br></br>Migrants queue upon their arrival at the harbor of Malaga, Aug. 29, 2019, after an inflatable boat carrying 132 migrants was rescued by the Spanish coast guard off the coast of Spain. Jorge Guerrero/AFP/Getty Images

Spanish bullfighter Paco Urena fights a bull as part of Semana Grande (Big Week) fair at Vista Alegre bullring in Bilbao, Spain, Aug. 23, 2019. Miguel Tona/EPA via Shutterstock

Relatives of victims wait for news about their loves ones at the entrance to the Caballo Blanco bar after an attack in Cotzacoalcos, Mexico, Aug. 27, 2019. A total of 23 people died and 13 others were injured in a fire caused by an alleged attack with molotov cocktails. Authorities are investigating the causes of the fire to confirm it was caused by an attack. EPA via Shutterstock

A police officer in riot gear aims a gun in front of a protester during a clash in the Tsuen Wan district of Hong Kong, Aug. 25, 2019. Hong Kong police officers drew pistols on protesters who were charging them with sticks, and one appeared to fire a warning shot into the air after another officer fell, as a weekend of violent clashes brought an end to nearly two weeks of restraint. Lam Yik Fei/The New York Times via Redux Pictures

Serena Williams serves during round 1 of the women's singles tennis match against Russia's Maria Sharapova during the 2019 US Open at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in New York, Aug. 26, 2019. Kena Betancur/AFP/Getty Images

A sea lion swims in its enclosure as people reach out while visiting the Smithsonian National Zoo in Washington, DC, Aug. 22, 2019. Alastair Pike/AFP/Getty Images

People participate in a tomato fight during the La Tomatina Festival, Aug. 28, 2019, in Bunol, Spain. The Tomatina Festival began in 1945 but was forbidden during the Franco Regime. There are two rules; only tomatoes may be thrown and that they must be squashed before launch. Borja B. Hojas/Getty Images

A section of the Amazon rainforest that has been decimated by wild fires is seen from above, Aug. 25, 2019, in the Candeias do Jamari region near Porto Velho, Brazil. According to INPE, Brazil's National Institute of Space Research, the number of fires detected by satellite in the Amazon region this month is the highest since 2010. Victor Moriyama/Getty Images

The carcass of a cow lies along a tract of the Amazon jungle as it is cleared by loggers and farmers in Porto Velho, Brazil, Aug. 24, 2019. Ueslei Marcelino/Reuters

Protesters hold hands to form a human chain during a rally to call for political reforms at Tsim Sha Tsui and Hung Hom Promenade in Hong Kong, China, Aug. 23, 2019. Willy Kurniawan/Reuters

Shardae Edmondson, 11, is consoled by her mother Sharonda Edmondson and sister Zha'lea Thompson, 7, during a vigil for murdered children in St. Louis held at Herzog Elementary School, Aug. 28, 2019,in St. Louis, Mo. Shardae and Zha'lea are sisters of 8-year-old Jurnee Thompson who was killed by a stray bullet last on Aug. 23. David Carson/St. Louis Post-Dispatch via AP
description: Find this week's top photos from around the globe in ABC News' This Week in Pictures slideshow
